page.title: 18The Wood, Tongue
page.content: The Lady of the Wood 'I went into the wood to explore and it was very quiet. It had rained and the trees were slender and smooth. The twigs were delicate and covered with blossom giving the air a fresh and fragrant smell. The leaves were soft and silky and the wind made the trees murmur. Then I saw the tree called the Lady of the Woods. She was sitting right in the middle of the wood. She swayed from side to side and the wind gently rustled the leaves glistening in the sunlight. The smooth fragile leaves danced as a wisp of wind caught them.' This was written by a boy of ten after we stood in the middle of our little group of trees and really looked and listened.
